description: Via Middle English varix from Latin varix, ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *wers-. See also Old Church Slavonic врьхъ (vrĭxŭ, “top, peak”), Ancient Greek ἕρμα (hérma, “reef, rock, hill”), Lithuanian viršus (“top”).

entries.meaning: (medicine) A varicose, i.e. swollen and knotted, vein.
(zoology) In mollusks, a particular ridge on the shell, corresponding to a former position of the aperture.
